intro: Guatteria simiarum, commonly known as the "monkey guatteria," is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a fragrant aroma. Guatteria simiarum produces dark blue or black berries that are edible and contain several seeds.
